glsa.title: Mercurial: Directory traversal
glsa.synopsis: A directory traversal vulnerability in Mercurial allows for the renaming of arbitrary files.

background.p: Mercurial is a distributed Source Control Management system.

description.p: Jakub Wilk discovered a directory traversal vulnerabilty in the applydiff() function in the mercurial/patch.py file.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to import a specially crafted patch, possibly resulting in the renaming of arbitrary files, even outside the repository.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Mercurial users should upgrade to the latest version:
